newsitem.title: ROMANIA: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.
newsitem.headline: RADIO ROMANIA AFTERNOON HEADLINES AT 1 PM.

text.p: * World Bank President James Wolfensohn, visiting Romania, met Prime Minister Victor Ciorbea.

The radio quoted Wolfensohn as saying that the World Bank would give Romania loans worth $600 million in 1997. The money would come from a second tranche of the Financial and Enterprise Structural Adjustment Loan (FESAL), a new Agriculture Structural Adjustment Loan (ASAL) and from a social welfare project loan as the country restructures its economy.
The World Bank was worried about dropping living standards in rural areas of Romania, the radio quoted Wolfensohn as saying.
* Romanian President Emil Constantinescu opened a conference on regional development in Romania, as part of local PHARE projects.

* The Romanian troops on the multi-national mission in Albania were taken into subordination by the mission's Italian command in the Albanian town of Gjirokaster on Monday. -- Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
